property.name: Text
property.value: You have 2 additional paw slots which can only be used to hold Weapon assets. Yes, that's right. You heard me. Don't ask how. ε effect: +2. Reduce the cost of the next Weapon asset you play this round by 2.

property.name: Text
property.value: Deck size: 30. Deckbuilding Options: Guardian cards (κ) level 0-5, Neutral cards level 0-5, Weapon cards level 0. Deckbuilding Requirements (do not count toward deck size): Catling Gun, More Bark Than Bite, 1 random basic weakness.

property.name: Text
property.value: Bark Harrigan deck only. Uses (12 ammo). η η Spend 1–3 ammo: Fight. You get +X ή and deal +X damage for this attack. X is the amount of ammo spent as part of this ability's cost.

property.name: Text
property.value: Revelation – Put More Bark Than Bite into your threat area. You get –3 ή. (BARK! BARK! BARK!) Forced – After you defeat an enemy: Discard More Bark Than Bite.

property.name: Text
property.value: While you are at a location you've sniffed, each skill test you perform gets –1 difficulty. η: Sniff your location or a connecting location. This action does not provoke attacks of opportunity. ε effect: +0. Sniff your location or a connecting location.

property.name: Text
property.value: Deck size: 30. Deckbuilding Options: Seeker cards (λ) level 0-5, Neutral cards level 0-5, up to five other level 0 cards that look like they would smell weird. Deckbuilding Requirements (do not count toward deck size): Feline Discombobulator, Foul Odor, 1 random basic weakness.

property.name: Text
property.value: Kate Winthpup deck only. ι When an enemy would spawn at your location, if that enemy is a cat, looks like a cat, or is some kind of weird cat-person hybrid, exhaust Feline Discomboluator: Automatically evade it.

property.name: Text
property.value: Revelation – Put Foul Odor into play in your threat area. Forced – After you perform a skill test at a location you have sniffed: Take 1 horror. η: Discard Foul Odor and unsniff everything you've sniffed.

property.name: Text
property.value: η Spend 1 resource: Move. You give a human puppy dog eyes until they give you a car ride. Move up to 3 times, ignoring enemy engagement. (Limit once per round.) ε effect: +2. Deal 1 damage to the next enemy whose location you enter this round.

property.name: Text
property.value: Deck size: 30. Deckbuilding Options: Rogue cards (ν) level 0-5, Neutral cards level 0-5, up to five other level 0 cards that "move" you (and by "move" we mean physically, not emotionally.) Deckbuilding Requirements (do not count toward deck size): Take the Wheel, Dogcatchers, 1 random basic weakness.

property.name: Traits
property.value: What? No. Stop. That's bad. Bad dog.

property.name: Text
property.value: "Skids" O'Drool deck only. Fast. Play only during your turn. For the remainder of your turn, whenever you enter a location, deal 3 damage to an enemy at that location.

property.name: Text
property.value: Prey – "Skids" O'Drool. Hunter. Forced – After you enter Dogcatcher's location or Dogcatchers enters your location: You cannot move for the remainder of the round.

property.name: Text
property.value: θ Bury 1 card from your hand facedown beneath Jacqueline Canine: Draw 1 card. (Limit once per round.) η: Choose and dig up 1 or 2 buried cards, returning them to your hand. ε effect: +1. Dig up a buried card, returing it to your hand.

property.name: Text
property.value: Deck size: 30. Deckbuilding Options: Mystic cards (μ) level 0-5, Neutral cards level 0-5, up to five other level 0 cards that are cats or have cats in their artwork. (Blasphemy!) Deckbuilding Requirements (do not count toward deck size): Chew Toy of Nightmare, No Sense of Space or Time, 1 random basic weakness.

property.name: Text
property.value: Jacqueline Canine deck only. You may commit buried cards to skill tests as if they were in your hand.

card.name: No Sense of Space or Time

property.name: Text
property.value: Revelation – Oh no! You forgot where you buried all your cards! For each card you have buried, either take 1 horror or discard it.

property.name: Text
property.value: You begin the game with Friendly Human in play. η η: You beg for more treats. Place 3 treats on Friendly Human. ε effect: +2. Place 1 treat on Friendly Human. After this test ends, ready him.

property.name: Text
property.value: Deck size: 30. Deckbuilding Options: Survivor cards (ξ) level 0-5, Neutral cards level 0-5, up to five other level 0 Ally cards who are either other dogs or humans who want to pet you. Deckbuilding Requirements (do not count toward deck size): Friendly Human, Out of Doggie Treats, 1 random basic weakness. Deckbuilding Restrictions: ABSOLUTELY NO CARDS UNDER ANY CIRCUMSTANCES!

property.name: Text
property.value: Duke deck only. Uses (5 treats). ι After you succeed at a skill test, spend 1 treat: Good boy! Either (choose one) – — Heal 1 damage or 1 horror. — Draw 1 card. — Gain 1 resource.

property.name: Text
property.value: Revelation – Remove all treats from Friendly Human.

property.name: Text
property.value: Barkham deck only. ι When an enemy attack deals damage to you, exhaust Spiked collar: Deal 1 damage to the attacking enemy.

property.name: Text
property.value: Barkham deck only. You get +1 έ while investigating and also +1 skill value during parley actions, because, I mean, honestly, look at you.

property.name: Text
property.value: Barkham deck only. θ During your turn, exhaust Hired Dogs: Fight/Investigate. Either attack with a base ή skill of 4, or investigate with a base έ skill of 4. After this test ends, either pay 1 resource in dog food or discard Hired Dogs.

property.name: Text
property.value: Barkham deck only. Evade. The enemy chosen for this evasion attempt must be the enemy with the highest evade value. This evasion attempt uses ά instead of ή. If you succeed, automatically evade each non-Elite enemy in play.

property.name: Text
property.value: Barkham deck only. θ Deal 1 damage to Old Shoe: Heal 1 horror.

property.name: Text
property.value: Barkham deck only. Max 1 committed per skill test. After this skill test ends, the investigator performing this test gets –2 skill value for the next skill test they perform this round.

property.name: Text
property.value: α: –X. X is half the number of Meowsk enemies in play, in the victory display, and attached to Meowlathotep, rounded up. β: –2. If you fail, place 1 doom on the nearest enemy. γ: –2. If you fail, place 1 of your clues on your location. δ: -5. Woof.

property.name: Text
property.value: α: –X. X is the number of Meowsk enemies in play, in the victory display, and attached to Meowlathotep. β: –2. Place 1 doom on the nearest enemy. γ: –2. Place 1 of your clues on your location. δ: –7. Woof.

property.name: Text
property.value: θ Investigators at a location that is lousy with cats spend 2π clues, as a group: Add the card beneath that location to the victory display. η If you are at a location that is lousy with cats: Flip the card beneath that location and spawn it at that location, exhausted.

property.name: Text
property.value: If no locations are lousy with cats, advance to agenda 2a. If at least 1 location is lousy with cats, find the one that is farthest from all investigators. Flip the card beneath that location over and spawn it at that location. Reset the agenda deck to agenda 1a.

property.name: Text
property.value: Objective – At the start of the investigation phase, if no locations are lousy with cats, advance.

property.name: Text
property.value: Spawn the set-aside Meowlathotep enemy at a Central location of your choice. For each Meowsk enemy in play, attach that enemy facedown to Meowlathotep. Now Meolathotep is the one who is lousy with cats! Advance to act 2a and agenda 2a.

property.name: Text
property.value: η Spend 1 clue: Deal 2 damage to an enemy at your location, or 1 damage without provoking attacks of opportunity. Objective – If Meowlathotep is defeated, advance.

property.name: Text
property.value: θ Spend 2 resources: You follow a weird scent heading south. Move to Slobbertown. (Group limit once per round.)

property.name: Text
property.value: θ Spend 2 resources: You pursue a raccoon for no reason. Move to Beasttown. (Group limit once per round.)

property.name: Text
property.value: θ Spend 2 resources: You chase a delivery truck to the north. Move to Tailside. (Group limit once per round.)

property.name: Text
property.value: θ Spend 2 resources: Barkham has no leash laws! You take yourself for a walk. Move to Snoutside. (Group limit once per round.)

property.name: Text
property.value: η: Heal 3 horror. (Limit once per game.) η Take 1 horror: Parley. You overhear a strange way of barking. Baroo! Baroo! Catthulhu woofthagn! Test ά (4) to learn how to bark that way too. If you succeed, remember that you "learned the bark of the outer gods."

property.name: Text
property.value: ι After you successfully investigate Boneyard by 2 or more: Place 1 resource on Boneyard, as a bone. (What did you expect?) η If there are 1π bones on Boneyard: Nice! That's a lot of bones! Remove them and remember that you "buried the bones a few meters from where you found them"

property.name: Text
property.value: η: Draw 3 cards. (Limit once per game.) η Discard cards from your hand with a total of at least 3 έ icons on them: Remember that you "brushed up on cat physiology."

property.name: Text
property.value: η: Gain 3 resources. (Limit once per game.) η Spend 1 resource: Parley. Test ί (4) to convince the employees to part with some cat toys by acting adorable. If you succeed, remember that you "possess a ball of yarn."

property.name: Text
property.value: η: Heal 3 damage. You're not happy about it, though. (Limit once per game.) η Take 1 damage: Parley. Test έ (4) to schedule a visit to the vet for a cat. This is physically painful for you. If you succeed, remember that "a cat has an appointment with the vet."

property.name: Text
property.value: η: Parley. Test ά (5). You beg and beg and beg. If you succeed, remember that you "scored some tasty food." You also take some for yourself; heal 1 damage and 1 horror.

property.name: Text
property.value: Hunter. Meowlathotep gets +1 π health for each Meowsk enemy attached to it. Meowlathotep gets +1 fight and +1 evade for every 2 Meowsk enemies attached to it. While there are 3 or more Meowsk enemies attached to it, Meowlathotep gains retaliate and alert.

property.name: Text
property.value: Alert. Hunter. This enemy gets +1 π health. Forced – While The Hisser in the Dark is engaged with you, if you enter and leave each of the Central locations in one turn: It becomes extremely dizzy. Add it to the victory display.

property.name: Text
property.value: Hunter. Retaliate. This enemy gets +1 π health. η If you "possess a ball of yarn": Parley. You throw the ball of yarn into a perfect 90 degree corner. The Cat of Tindalos predictably follows into an extradimensional pocket. Add it to the victory display.

property.name: Text
property.value: Alert. Hunter. This enemy gets +1 π health. η If you "brushed up on cat physiology": Parley. You inform the Dweller in the Deep that it has no gills and therefore cannot breathe underwater. The universe self-corrects for the paradox and Dweller in the Deep ceases to exist. Add it to the victory display.

property.name: Text
property.value: Hunter. This enemy gets +1 π health. η If you "scored some tasty food": Parley. The hungry twins have been placated. They curl up happily in a box and fall asleep. Add this enemy to the victory display.

property.name: Subtitle
property.value: Cat That is Also a Ghost

property.name: Text
property.value: Alert. Hunter. This enemy gets +1 π health. η If you "buried the bones a few meters from where you found them": Parley. Oh. That's what those were. Well that's sad. Still the cat's spirit is appeased. Add this enemy to the victory display.

property.name: Subtitle
property.value: It's Exactly What it Sounds Like

property.name: Text
property.value: Hunter. This enemy gets +1 π health. η If you "learned the bark of the outer gods": Parley. You perform the aforementioned bark. The byakat flies off, but the other cat stays. Add this enemy to the victory display. Search the encounter deck and discard pile for an Estranged Cat and spawn it at your location.

property.name: Text
property.value: Hunter. Retaliate. This enemy gets +1 π health. η If "a cat has an appointment with the vet": Parley. What? Oh, heck no. The cat flees in absolute terror. Add this enemy to the victory display.

property.name: Text
property.value: Spawn – Any empty location. Forced – After Estranged Cat enters play: Place 1 doom on it. Forced – When Estranged Cat would be defeated: It runs away to the discard pile, but isn't injured at all (please, I'm not a monster).

property.name: Text
property.value: Prey – Investigator nearest to a card that is lousy with cats. Hunter.

property.name: Text
property.value: Spawn – Any empty location. Retaliate. Forced – At the end of the mythos phase: Place 1 doom on Order Cultist.

property.name: Text
property.value: Spawn – Location with the most enemies (including facedown encounter cards). Alert. Retaliate.

property.name: Text
property.value: Revelation – IT'S A SQUIRREL! You must chase it! Test ί (4). For each point you fail by, lose 1 action.

property.name: Text
property.value: Revelation – Put Huntedby Byakats into play in your threat area. As an additional cost to perform any of the following actions (move, fight, or investigate), you must spend 1 resource in cat food to appease the pursuing Byakats. Forced – At the end of your turn: Test έ (3). If you succeed, discard Hunted by Byakats.

property.name: Text
property.value: Revelation – If there are no enemies in play, On Your Tail gains surge. Otherwise, place 1 doom on the enemy nearest to you and test ί (X), where X is that enemy's evade value. If you fail, that enemy attacks you.

property.name: Text
property.value: Revelation – Test ά (3). For each point you fail by, take 1 horror.

property.name: Text
property.value: Revelation – Test ί (3). For each point you fail by, take 1 damage.

property.name: Text
property.value: Revelation – If... — ...Meolathotep is in play, it attacks each investigator, in play order. — ...at least 1 location is lousy with cats, choose one of those locations. Flip the card beneath that location over and spawn it at that location. — ...neither is true, this card gains surge.

property.name: Text
property.value: Revelation – Attach to the location in play with the most clues. A cat is laying on all the evidence at this location. You obviously cannot investigate attached location. η: Test ά (4) or ί (4) to shoo the cat away. If you succeed, discard Stubborn Cat.

property.name: Text
property.value: Revelation – Test ά (4). If you fail, choose an asset you control and slowly push it until it falls off the table (if you cannot, take 2 damage instead). Cards that fall of the table in this way are removed from the game.

property.name: Text
property.value: Revelation – Test [Willpwer] (5). For each point you fail by, either lose 1 resource or choose an discard 1 card from your hand. If this effect forces you to lose all of your resources and discard all of your cards, you feel really creeped out.
